author: samuraiturtle
title: Lets Launch This Thing
review: I felt this set was lacking some thing.  One thing that could of improve the set would of been another crystal and maybe a plate for the catapult.  I got the 8907 Rock Hacker at the same time as this set and I think the 8907 Rock Hacker is the better of the two.  The only reason I think anyone would get this set is for the Rock Monster.  But if you combine this set with the 8907 Rock Hacker it is a better deal than the 8956 Stone Chopper.  (I am assuming you can still get this set.  It was found only at Target Stores for the 2009 fall quarter.)

author: Tommy_60
title: It works!
review:
My friend got me this set along with the rock hacker when he went to Legoland California last week.  I love this set!  The catapult function actually works!  If you hit it hard enough, the rockmonster or whatever you're catapulting can go up to 7 feet!  Maybe farther!  

Pros : The catapult works!
Sulfurix rockmonster included!
Yellow crystal!
3 2x3 slanted bricks!
There are extra pieces!  Tons of 'em!
Cons : WHY IN THE WORLD WOULD THIS SET HAVE CONS?!?!?!?!?!?!  Lego made it, thus it's perfect!

Overall rating : 100/10

author: bmwlego
title: Not Much in the Bag
review: This set has a grand total of 12 parts! I bought this set simply for the Rock Monster. It does launch like it shows on the package which is a cool play feature but you get what you see with this set. Not even any extra parts. I now have 5 of these little Rock Monsters so if I want to make a Power Miners scene I have the Rock Monsters to do so.

author: jonbuddy
title: 1 monster + 1 energy crystal + a flinger= Tons of comical action!
review:
Although SOME people think this set stinks because of it having only 12 pieces, I think it's still nice. When you can get a chance to fling rock monsters (and maybe fling them far), why would you pass up this set?

Overall - This set is good, the flinging is fun, and you get a green rock monster. Cool, right?

P.S. Did I mention flinging? :P

author: mokey2345
title: SUPER SULFURIX
review:
I got this set of ebay for £6.84 and I know its expensive but im in the uk.

 pros:

  • sulfurix
  • crystal
  • catapult

 cons:

  • to small
  • not alot of pieces

author: handsome_skellington
title: BONZAI!
review:
This is a pretty neat set that I got, so let's get down to the pros and cons...

PROS
nice launcher
SULFURIX!!
crystal

CONS
none!

OVERALL
Pretty neat set, get if you have the chance!(doubt you'll find this at a store, try eBay!

author: TheFadedTBCap
title: Nice Little Set
review:
This a pretty good set.  It needs a power miner to fight Sulfurix though and it was very expensive.  It does make a good addition to the Power Miners collection.

 

Pros:

 

Sulfurix

 

Canapult really works

 

Comes with crystal

 

Cons:

 

Not a lot of pieces (only twelve)

 

Very expensive (or thats just the price I paid)

 

This definitely a solid set.  Could use more pieces or something small added to it, but it is still a fun set to play with.  I give it a 3.5/5 or 7/10!

author: Lego7755Fan2
title: AAAAAAHHHHHHH!
review:
Good set, got it for $2.99. It was the only one at my Target. I mainly got this for the Sulfurix and Crystal.

Pros

  • Play value-You can throw rock monsters and Crystals
  • …

Cons

  • Very high price per piece.
  • Very Rare!
  • …

Overall, very nice, one of my only Power Miners sets.
